excerpt: Buddhist monastery in a mountain setting, offering tranquil surrounds & picturesque views.
detail_description: Namgyal Monastery is a prominent Tibetan temple located in the serene town of Dharamshala, amidst picturesque mountain views. It is also known as Dalai Lama's Temple and serves as the official residence of the Dalai Lama. The monastery offers a tranquil environment for meditation and yoga sessions, attracting visitors seeking spiritual retreats. With over 200 practicing monks, it stands as the largest Tibetan shrine outside Tibet, embodying pure Buddhism.
name: Namgyal Monastery
address: 68MF+2X2, Temple Rd, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt:
Dharamkot is a small hill station in Kangra district in the state of Himachal Pradesh, India.
On the crest of a hill above McLeodGanj, Dharamkot is a spot with wide views of the Kangra Valley and the Dhauladhar ranges. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Dharamkot, located in the Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, India, is a charming hill station perched atop a hill overlooking McLeodGanj. It offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Kangra Valley and the Dhauladhar ranges.
name: Dharamkot
address: Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: Pilgrimage site featuring the Dalai Lama's temple, a monastery, stupas, a museum, library & cafe.
detail_description: The Dalai Lama Temple, Tsuglagkhang Complex, is a significant pilgrimage site in McLeod Ganj. It serves as the official residence of the 14th Dalai Lama and features the Namgyal Monastery, which is known for being the largest Tibetan temple outside Tibet. The complex offers visitors a rare glimpse into Tibetan culture and life, making it an ideal place to experience peace and spirituality.
name: Dalai Lama Temple, Tsuglagkhang Complex
address: Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: 18th-century church featuring a Neo-Gothic brick facade, stained-glass windows & a viceroy's tomb.
detail_description: Nestled in the serene deodar forests, the Church of St. John in the Wilderness is a stunning 18th-century structure that showcases exquisite Neo-Gothic architecture. Built in 1852 and dedicated to John the Baptist, this charming church features beautiful Belgian stained-glass windows gifted by Lady Elgin. A visit here offers more than just spiritual solace; it’s a gateway to adventure!
name: Church of St. John in the Wilderness
address: Road to Naddi Village from McLeod Ganj, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176215, India

detail_description: Naddi View Point, situated in the picturesque Naddi Village near McLeod Ganj, offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the majestic Dhauladhar mountains. This spot is particularly stunning during winter when the peaks are cloaked in snow. Visitors can drive or hike to this vantage point to capture stunning sunset views and take advantage of telescope facilities for mountain gazing.
name: Naddi View Point
address: Naddi, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176216, India

excerpt: Cultural venue offering traditional Tibetan opera, dance & drama productions & training programs.
detail_description: Tibetan Institute of Performing Arts (TIPA) is a cultural venue dedicated to preserving traditional Tibetan opera, dance, and drama. Founded by the 14th Dalai Lama, TIPA offers training programs and showcases the rich heritage of Tibet through folk dance, music, martial arts, and colorful folk opera. The institute hosts the week-long Shoton festival in August, attracting visitors from all over with its vibrant cultural shows.
name: Tibetan Institute of Performing Arts - TIPA (བོད་ཀྱི་ཟློས་གར་ཚོགས་པ།)
address: Dharamkot Rd, P.O, McLeod Ganj, McLeodganj, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Trek Ace- Triund Trek is one of the most popular hiking treks in Himachal Pradesh, starting at 2100m and finishing at 2850m on the Triund campsite, covering about 7 km. The path is well-maintained with low difficulty level suitable for everyone. There are several cafes with water filling points along the way and breathtaking aerial views of the entire Kangra valley during good weather.
name: Trek Ace- Triund Trek
address: Trail to Triund Hill, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176216, India

detail_description: The Dalai Lama Temple, also known as Tsuglagkhang, is a significant site in Dharamshala, India. It became a sanctuary for the 14th Dalai Lama and many Tibetan exiles following the failed Tibetan uprising. The complex houses shrines, temples, a Tibetan museum, and souvenir stores.
name: Dalai Lama temple
address: Temple Rd, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: McLeod Ganj or McLeodganj is a suburb of Dharamshala, in the Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh, India. It is known as "Little Lhasa" or "Dhasa" as the Tibetan government-in-exile is headquartered here and there is a significant population of Tibetans in the region. Wikipedia.
detail_description: McLeod Ganj, also known as Little Lhasa, is a charming suburb of Dharamshala in Himachal Pradesh, India. It's home to the Tibetan government-in-exile and has a significant Tibetan population. Originally developed by British officials as a summer retreat, it's now a popular tourist destination for its serene atmosphere and lush greenery.
name: McLeod Ganj
address: Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh, India

detail_description: Dhamma Sikhara Vipassana Himachal Meditation Centre offers 10 to 15-day meditation sessions where participants disconnect from the outside world. The center aims to help people observe reality as it is through ancient meditation techniques. Separate accommodations are provided for men and women, along with three meditation halls, a dining hall, and dormitories. The courses operate on a donation basis and are based on the teachings of Guruji SN Goenka.
name: Dhamma Sikhara Vipassana Himachal Meditation Centre
address: Kangra,McLeodganj,Dharamsala, Dharamkot, Shimla, Himachal Pradesh 171001, India

detail_description: In McLeod Ganj, near Dharamsala, the Kalachakra Temple is a prominent Tibetan temple within the Thekchen Chling complex. Built in 1992, it features stunning paintings of Kalachakra (Wheel of Time) associated with Avalokitesvara. Following Buddhist tradition, visitors circumambulate Tsuglagkhang Temple and enter the westernmost building to find the Kalachakra Temple. This small monastery boasts intricate and vibrant murals and houses a stupa.
name: Kalachakra temple
address: 68QF+8H7, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: The Indrhar Pass Trek is a thrilling high-altitude adventure in the Indian Himalayas. This trek offers breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks, lush meadows, and pristine lakes. The trail takes trekkers through remote villages and ancient temples, providing a glimpse into the local culture and way of life. With its challenging terrain and ever-changing landscapes, this trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.
name: Indrhar pass Trek
address: lazy Monk cafe, Dharamkot, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: The Head Office, Tibetan Children's Village School is located about 15-20 minutes from McLeod in Upper Dharamsala. The school provides a peaceful atmosphere surrounded by natural greenery and features a large playground, outdoor activities area, and clean and spacious classrooms. Former students express gratitude for the supportive and loving teachers and staff who have helped them learn independence and thrive in an environment that emphasizes education, Tibetan culture, and religion.
name: Head Office, Tibetan Children's Village School
address: The Head Office, Tibetan Children's Villages, Cantt, Dharamshala, Jangal Reserve Banoi, Himachal Pradesh 176216, India

detail_description: Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamshala is located in the picturesque Kangra Valley, surrounded by the majestic Dhauladhar mountains and lush pine and deodar forests. The town of Dharamshala offers a blend of Tibetan and Indian cultures, with vibrant neighborhoods like Mcleod Ganj and Sindhbari to explore. As the residence of the Dalai Lama, it's known for its Tibetan temples and rich traditions.
name: Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium, Dharamshala
address: Cricket Stadium, Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association, Tehsil, Distt, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176215, India

detail_description: Shiva Cafe is a popular spot located near the Bhagsunag Waterfall in Mcleodganj, about 3 km from the city center. Accessible after a steep uphill walk, this hippie establishment offers delectable dishes and an exceptionally photogenic setting. The serene ambiance, sound of gushing water, and excellent music collection create a relaxing experience.
name: Shiva Cafe
address: 68W2+MQV, Unnamed Road, Satovari, Tota Rani, Dhial, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Tibetan Mini Market, located in Mcleodganj, is a bustling and vibrant market offering a wide range of souvenirs, home decor items, religious artifacts, traditional handicrafts, and Tibetan goods. Visitors can immerse themselves in the rich cultural heritage of Tibet while browsing through stalls filled with traditional clothing, jewelry, and handicrafts. The market also provides an opportunity to sample local food and interact with friendly local vendors.
name: Tibetan Mini Market
address: 68QF+GG5, Jogiwara Rd, McLeod Ganj, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Located 3 km from McLeod Ganj, Bhagsunag Temple, also known as Bhagsunath Temple, is a renowned ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is highly popular among Hindus and the local Gorkha community. Situated in the mountains, this beautiful temple offers a serene atmosphere and is surrounded by bustling bazaars, hotels, restaurants, and gift shops. A must-visit destination with pleasant weather and stunning views.
name: Temple
address: 68WJ+MVJ, Bhagsu Nag, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: A visit to Dharamshala wouldn't be complete without embarking on the exhilarating trek to Triund, situated near McLeoganj. Whether you're a seasoned trekker or a novice, the journey to Triund promises an unmatched thrill and an opportunity to connect with nature.
name: Triund
address: 68VC+2GJ, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: Dharamshala is a city in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. Surrounded by cedar forests on the edge of the Himalayas, this hillside city is home to the Dalai Lama and the Tibetan government-in-exile. The Thekchen Chöling Temple Complex is a spiritual center for Tibetan Buddhism, while the Library of Tibetan Works and Archives houses thousands of precious manuscripts.
detail_description: Dharamshala, located in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh, is a picturesque hillside city nestled amidst cedar forests on the edge of the Himalayas. It is renowned as the residence of the Dalai Lama and the Tibetan government-in-exile. The city boasts spiritual landmarks such as Thekchen Chöling Temple Complex and the Library of Tibetan Works and Archives.
name: Dharamshala
address: Himachal Pradesh, India

detail_description: Nestled in the serene village of Dharamkot, Tushita Meditation Centre is a renowned hub for the study and practice of Tibetan Mahayana tradition Buddhism. The center offers courses ranging from 2 to 10 days throughout most of the year, along with daily meditation classes. Visitors can also enjoy tours to nearby villages like Naddi and Triundi.
name: Tushita Meditation Centre
address: 68WG+48Q, Dharamkot, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: War memorial displaying names of soldiers in a natural setting surrounded by tall trees & gardens.
detail_description: The State War Memorial in Dharamshala is a serene tribute to the martyrs of Kangra valley, surrounded by lush green forests. It commemorates the soldiers who lost their lives during the Indo-China War and UN Peace Operations. The memorial features three large black stone panels displaying the names of the brave heroes. Visitors can take silent walks amidst nature and also explore nearby attractions like Bhagsu Falls and Bhagsunath Temple.
name: State War Memorial
address: Kachehri Road, Jawahar Nagar, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176215, India

detail_description: Tibet World is located in a district that shares borders with Ladakh, Tibet, and the Kullu valley. The region's altitude ranges from over 6,500 m to 2,740 m where the Chenab River exits. Spiti, a cold desert valley in Himachal Pradesh, is known for its pine trees, green meadows, monasteries and villages. Visitors praise the peaceful atmosphere and stunning views from the rooms and balcony.
name: Tibet World
address: Tibet world, Tashi Choeling Monastery, Jogiwara Rd, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Nestled in the Kangra district of McLeod Ganj, Himachal Pradesh, Dal Lake is a picturesque destination surrounded by deodar trees and distant mountains. Boating is a popular activity during the summer months, offering visitors a chance to soak in the serene ambiance. At an altitude of 1,775 meters above sea level near Tota Rani village, this charming lake invites nature enthusiasts to observe its diverse fish population.
name: Dal Lake
address: McLeod Ganj, Himachal Pradesh 176219

excerpt: Naddi is a village in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. It is located at an altitude of 2,000 metres above sea level, in the upper reaches of the Kangra valley. The village is situated about 3 kilometres from Mc Leod Ganj, known worldwide for the presence of the Dalai Lama. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Naddi, a charming village in Himachal Pradesh, India, sits at an elevation of 2000 meters in the upper Kangra valley. Just 3 kilometers from the renowned Mc Leod Ganj, it offers stunning views of the mountains and is known for being close to the Dalai Lama's residence. Visitors can indulge in the simple joy of savoring a bowl of Maggi noodles while taking in the breathtaking mountain scenery.
name: Naddi
address: Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque town of McLeod Ganj, Lung Ta Japanese Restaurant offers a taste of Japan with its authentic and high-quality traditional Japanese meals. Run by a Japanese chef and her Tibetan husband, this much-celebrated vegetarian restaurant is known for its sushi, ramen, bento boxes, and set meals. The cozy ambiance and serene environment make it an ideal spot for a relaxing dinner while enjoying stunning mountain views from the outdoor seating area.
name: Lung Ta Japanese Restaurant
address: 68PG+6QP, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: Easygoing locale offering vegan breakfast & traditional entrees, plus outdoor seating.
detail_description: Bodhi Greens is a relaxed vegan cafe that offers a variety of vegan breakfast options and traditional dishes. The cafe has outdoor seating, providing a peaceful ambiance to enjoy your meal while overlooking the bustling main square below. Visitors can indulge in healthy smoothies like the banana smoothie infused with basil, mint, clove, cinnamon, fennel, and ginger.
name: Bodhi Greens - Where Food is Medicine by Chef Varun
address: Main Street, Dharamkot, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Located on the banks of the beautiful Triund River, Triund Camps Riverside Resort offers a wide range of activities for all ages. From fishing, swimming, and kayaking to hiking and biking, there is something for everyone to enjoy. The resort features comfortable tents and cabins as well as an affordable campground with plenty of space for RVs.
name: Triund Camps Riverside Resort
address: heeru village, Bhagsunag Rd, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: The Tibetan Handicrafts Cooperative Centre, located on Thandi Sadak in Dalhousie, is a well-known shopping destination. This cooperative employs newly arrived Tibetans and refugees to work in the carpet weaving industry. Visitors can witness the skilled weavers meticulously handcrafting exquisite wool carpets with beautiful colors, textures, and designs. Additionally, customers can find custom-made clothing at the nearby tailoring section of the center.
name: Tibetan Handicrafts Centre
address: McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Tea Gardens Dharamshala Narghota, located in the Kangra Valley, is a serene paradise for tea lovers. The lush green landscape is home to some of the finest tea plants in the world, with the stunning Dhauladhar mountain range providing a breathtaking backdrop. Just 35 km from Dharamshala, Palampur Tea Gardens offer a picturesque destination to explore the region's tea culture and enjoy tours and tastings.
name: Tea Gardens
address: Narghota Road, Chilgari, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176216, India

detail_description: Dharamshala Skyway - McLeod Ganj Station is a popular destination in Himachal Pradesh, known for its bustling commercial hub in Dharamshala town and the quieter, tourist-friendly area of McLeod Ganj. Surrounded by the stunning Dhauladhar mountain ranges, it's an ideal spot for trekking enthusiasts. The area is also famous as the residence of the Dalai Lama, making it a significant spiritual center.
name: Dharamshala Skyway - McLeod Ganj Station
address: 68JG+FR8, Temple Rd, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Urban Camp McLeodGanj offers a wonderful camping experience with amazing views and a cozy atmosphere. While there are some stairs to tackle to reach the city center, the nearby café Illitetati is mind-blowing. The staff is friendly and always at your service, providing great food at an affordable price. The basic but functional toilets and showers are clean, ensuring a comfortable stay amidst stunning surroundings.
name: Camping in McLeodGanj - Urban Camp and homestay McLeodGanj
address: VILL- HEERU,P.O-MCLEODGANJ DHRAMSHALA, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: If you're a tea enthusiast, then the Dharamshala Tea Company is a must-visit destination. Located in the picturesque town of Dharamshala, this company offers an exceptional variety of fragrant and flavorful teas. From aromatic Darjeeling to Kangra Valley teas, there's something for every tea lover here. The teas are not only known for their top-notch quality but also come in beautifully designed packaging, making them perfect for gifting.
name: DHARMSALA TEA COMPANY
address: Narghota Road, Chilgari, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176216, India

detail_description: The Sunset Cafe, located near Gallu Devi temple, offers breathtaking views and unforgettable sunsets. The cozy and friendly cafe is a perfect spot to enjoy a hot cup of chai or delicious pizza while witnessing the day's retreat into peaceful rest. With its fantastic views and welcoming staff, it's a must-visit destination for anyone exploring the area. Make sure to arrive around 5:45-6 to catch the spectacular sunset with clouds above and below, creating a truly beautiful scene.
name: The Sunset Cafe
address: 785F+9RW, Kangra, Himachal Pradesh 176001, India

detail_description: Paragliding in Dharamshala by Bhagsunag Adventures offers an exhilarating experience for adventure enthusiasts. With the stunning mountain ranges and tea gardens as a backdrop, paragliders can soar through the clear blue skies at popular spots like Indrunag and Bir Billing. The experienced pilots provide a sense of security while ensuring an unforgettable flight. Additionally, visitors can combine their paragliding experience with camping and trekking for a complete adventure package.
name: Bhagsunag Adventures - Paragliding in Dharamshala
address: Khanyara Rd, Darnu, Dharamshala, Tahu, Himachal Pradesh 176215, India

detail_description: Men-Tsee-Khang Clinic, located in Dharamsala, is a renowned center for Tibetan medicine and astrology. The clinic offers a variety of traditional treatments such as Tibetan massage and herbal therapies. Visitors can also explore the Men-Tsee-Khang Museum to learn about ancient wisdom related to Tibetan medicine and astrology. Patients have praised the experienced doctors who provide thorough consultations by studying pulse readings and prescribing effective medicines with no reported side effects.
name: Men-Tsee-Khang Clinic
address: 68QG+W5Q, Dharamkot Rd, Bhagsu Nag, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

name: DIFF Venue,Picture Time 1
address: 68V6+MWP, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Jangal Reserve Banoi, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: The Gu Chu Sum Movement Association of Tibet is a non-profit organization that provides support to current and former Tibetan political prisoners. They also operate a gallery showcasing powerful photographs documenting the oppression in Tibet.
name: Gu Chu Sum Movement Association of Tibet
address: 68PG+6X4, Jogiwara Rd, McLeod Ganj, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

detail_description: Tempest Treks offers a wide range of exciting outdoor experiences, including the Everest Base Camp Trek, Chadar Trek, and Pawna Lake Camping. One traveler had an incredible time at Indrahaar Pass despite unpredictable weather conditions. The snow-covered base camp nestled in the Dhauladhar Range provided breathtaking views. This trek is recommended for those with some trekking experience looking for an unforgettable adventure.
name: Tempest Treks
address: Bhagsu Nag, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: A scenic panorama is the highlight of this mountain climb with campsites & chai spots en route.
detail_description: Triund, located in the Dhauladhar mountains near Dharamshala, is a popular trekking spot offering stunning views of the surrounding landscapes. The well-defined forest trails and breathtaking vistas make it a favorite among tourists from India and around the world. The last kilometer of the trek, known as the 22 curves, requires some effort but rewards with an incredible panorama. This camping site at the base of the Dhauladhar ranges provides accessible yet rewarding experiences for families and beginners.
name: Triund
address: Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: Ancient Hindu temple in a secluded compound with a pool & trails leading to a waterfall.
detail_description: Nestled in the tranquil hills of Dharamshala, India, Bhagsu Naag Temple is an ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Built around 1800 by 1 GR and worshipped primarily by 14 Gukha platoon villages in Dharamshala, it exudes a serene atmosphere and features intricate architecture. Adjacent to the temple is the Bhagsu Swimming Pool, offering a refreshing retreat for visitors.
name: Bhagsu Nag Temple
address: 68VM+PQF, Manisha Rd, Bhagsu Nag, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176219, India

excerpt: Cozy museum featuring photography & video exhibits devoted to the history & culture of Tibet.
detail_description: The Tibet Museum is a charming space that showcases the rich history and culture of Tibet through photography, video exhibits, and traditional artwork. The museum's elegant architecture combines Chinese and Tibetan styles, creating a beautiful setting for its collection of prehistoric cultural artifacts, folk art, treasures, and crafts. Visitors can explore the museum's modern facilities while learning about the struggles faced by the Tibetan people in the wake of Chinese invasion.
name: The Tibet Museum
address: 2nd Floor, T building, CTA, Gangchen Kyishong, Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh 176215, India

detail_description: Dip Tse Chok Ling is a Tibetan monastery located in McLeod Ganj, India. It was established by Yongzin Yeshi Gyaitsen, the tutor to the 8th Dalai Lama. The monastery offers a serene and picturesque setting, radiating tranquility and spirituality. Nestled amidst thick woods off the main area of McLeod Ganj, it provides an excellent atmosphere for those seeking solace and silence away from the hustle and bustle of tourist areas.
name: Dip Tse Chok Ling
address: 68QC+5R3, Camel Track Road, McLeod Ganj, Dharamsala, McLeod Ganj, Himachal Pradesh, India

detail_description: Shri Guna Devi Mandir is a Hindu temple located at an altitude above 2000 meters, offering an excellent view of the Indrahar pass in the Dhauladhar range. The trek to the temple is about 2 to 3 km and takes around 1.5 hours, passing through picturesque spots like Mcleodganj, Dal Lake, Naddi, and Baal.
name: Shri Guna Devi Mandir
address: 78F8+446, Trail to Shri Gunna Devi Mandir, Naddi, Dharamshala, Balreh, Himachal Pradesh 176216, India
